response:
Here are the key updates:

1. **China Ousted Foreign Minister Over Affair in US, WSJ Says**
   China has reportedly removed Qin Gang from his position as foreign minister following an investigation that concluded he had an affair and fathered a child while serving as ambassador to the US. 
   ![China Ousted Foreign Minister Over Affair in US, WSJ Says](https://s.yimg.com/ny/api/res/1.2/kLSLZbNQtLX2zfeYJKxXTA--/YXBwaWQ9aGlnaGxhbmRlcjt3PTEyMDA7aD04MDA-/https://media.zenfs.com/en/bloomberg_politics_602/b4e1ccac57c8eb1edab8a218818341c0)
   [Source](https://news.yahoo.com/china-ousted-foreign-minister-over-053242550.html)

2. **'Tesla Road Rage Guy' Gets Five Years In Prison**
   A notorious road rage driver, known as the 'Tesla road rage guy', has been sentenced to five years in prison in Southern California.
   [Source](https://jalopnik.com/tesla-road-rage-guy-gets-five-years-in-prison-1850849810)

3. **10 Tuesday AM Reads**
   The US Auto Labor Dispute and Recession Worries: Partial work stoppages can impact local economies, but the national effect should be minimal.
   [Source](https://ritholtz.com/2023/09/10-tuesday-am-reads-442/)

4. **Twitter is leaning on Google for help with its advertising business**
   Twitter, now under Elon Musk's ownership and renamed to X, is seeking help from Google to boost its advertising business. The platform has prioritized engagement for paying users and rolled back some site rules.
   [Source](https://qz.com/twitter-is-leaning-on-google-for-help-with-its-advertis-1850852952)
